name: Introduction to Python Programming and Data Science
body:
### Welcome to the Bootcamp
This bootcamp is designed for Northwestern students who have little to none previous experience with programming. Through interactive instruction and project-based work we plan to teach you the basics of programming python and data analysis.

###Requirements
**You must have a current laptop with Windows or OS X.**
If it is a Windows laptop then it should have Windows 7, 8, or 8.1 ([installation video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=w16iUU6IA5E))
If it is a Mac then it should have OS X 10.9 or 10.10 ([installation video](https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UQhOyZXHkxI))

###Expectations
We expect that students will attend all days of the bootcamp and complete the assigned homeworks each day. If you must miss a day of the bootcamp, we expect that you will tell us in advance. Also, you must achieve a high-passing score on that day's homework to remain in the bootcamp. 

At the end of this bootcamp you should be able/learned to:
* Write basic Python programs
* Perform data analysis in Python (plotting, averages, etc.)
* Basic image analysis
* Scrape web pages
* Basic textual analysis
* Basic structured data analysis

This course is intended as an introduction and to teach you basic programming and data analysis skills. Our goal is for you to acquire a breadth of experience and learn to think programmatically so that you can perform analyses on big data sets on your own/in the future. We are specifically **not** covering current Big Data technologies.

###Syllabus
**Day 1.**
Simple and complex data types, Flow Control

**Day 2.**
Filesystem, File I/O, Functions

**Day 3.**
Imports, Standard Library, Plotting, Review

**Day 4.**
Python Mini-Project, Image Analysis with Numpy

**Day 5.** 
Scraping the Web

**Day 6.**
Regular Expressions, Textual Analysis

**Day 7.**
Structured Data Analysis with Pandas
